Yanma nicknames

Yanma was introduced in Generation 2 with a Bug/Flying typing and evolves into Yanmega when leveled up while knowing the move Ancient Power.

Letâ€™s have a look at Yanmaâ€™s origins and some of those nicknames.

Origins

Yanma is a red dragonfly-like PokÃ©mon with a green head, four white wings with a single orange stripe on each one, and six legs. Its tail has two flat extensions on either side, similar to a helicopter or light aircraft (more on that comparison in the next paragraph).

It appears to be based on a dragonfly but I definitely see elements of helicopters in its design. Name-wise, Yanma comes from the word â€œyanmaâ€ (èœ»èœ“) meaning â€œlarge dragonflyâ€. Nuff said!

Nicknames

Iâ€™m gonna rank these by tiers: S, A, B, C, and D. S is the best and D is the worst.

(Please note: some nicknames were suggested by GPT-3.5 Turbo, a large language model [LLM] created by OpenAI. I usually prompt it to give me two lots of lists and I prune them. Most of them donâ€™t make the cut and Iâ€™ll always note if they were from an LLM. If I have used an LLM for a nickname, I will mark it with an asterisk in brackets.)

S-Tier

  • Airwolf - as it reminds me of the helicopter from Airwolf
  • Chroma(*)

A-Tier

  • Belle - from Bell, a helicopter manufacturer
  • Jamjar - derived from the Korean word â€œjamjariâ€ (ì ìë¦¬) meaning â€œdragonflyâ€
  • Griff - from the â€œgriffinflyâ€, said to be descendants of modern-day dragonflies
  • Camo - from their ability to motion camouflage
  • Haiku - they are apparently depicted frequently in Japanese art and literature, especially haiku poetry and I think the name is cute :3
  • Motif - as dragonflies were often used as motifs in Art Nouveau
  • Pepper - from a haiku by Japanese poet Matsuo BashÅ: Crimson pepper pod / add two pairs of wings, and look / darting dragonfly
  • Sparx - named after Sparx the dragonfly from Spyro: Enter the Dragonfly
  • Zephyr(*) - the original suggestion was Zephyrwing but Zephyr sounds better
  • Whisper - as quiet as its wings
  • Iris - I thought it was nice
  • Serena - as above
  • Jade - as above
  • Opal - as above

B-Tier

  • Jan - pronounced â€œYanâ€, from Yanyanma, its Japanese name
  • Sikorsky - named after Sikorsky, a helicopter manufacturer
  • Wilson Frisk - from its Hidden Ability, Frisk
  • Breezy(*) - the original suggestion was Breezytail but Breezy sounds better
  • Zenith
  • Gossamer(*) - something light, delicate, or insubstantial

C-Tier

  • Jessie - after Jessie of Team Rocket who caught a Yanma that evolved into Yanmega
  • Wings - youâ€™ll never guess the origins of this name!
  • Peekaboo - I dunno, it just sounds cute
  • Gen Z - because itâ€™s a zoomer? I dunno, Iâ€™ve run out of ideas
